name: USACO Silver Contest
detailedDescription:
Scored 800/1000 and ranked 574/3410 of precollege students. Achieved promotion to the Gold Division in the USA Computing Olympiad (USACO), a prestigious competitive programming contest for high school students.

The Gold Division involves advanced algorithms and data structures including segment trees, network flow, and dynamic programming techniques. You can find my solutions on my github at riddhimanrana/usaco-solutions

name: USACO Bronze Contest
detailedDescription:
Scored 1000/1000 and ranked 1st in the Bronze Division of the USA Computing Olympiad (USACO), a prestigious competitive programming contest for high school students.

The Bronze Division focuses on fundamental algorithms and data structures, including sorting, searching, and basic dynamic programming. You can find my solutions on my github at riddhimanrana/usaco-solutions

name: AMC 8
detailedDescription:
Scored 20/25 in the AMC 8, a mathematics competition for middle school students organized by the Mathematical Association of America (MAA).

The AMC 8 tests problem-solving skills and mathematical reasoning, covering topics such as algebra, geometry, and number theory.

name: AMC 10B
detailedDescription:
Scored 81 in the AMC 10B, a mathematics competition for high school students organized by the Mathematical Association of America (MAA).

The AMC 10B tests problem-solving skills and mathematical reasoning, covering topics such as algebra, geometry, and number theory.

name: Math Kangaroo
detailedDescription:
Scored 112/120 in the Math Kangaroo 2025, a mathematics competition for students from grades 1 to 12. Ranked 4th nationally and 3rd in the state.

The Math Kangaroo competition tests problem-solving skills and mathematical reasoning, covering topics such as algebra, geometry, and number theory.

name: Math Kangaroo International Camp
description: Attended International Math Kangaroo Camp in Zakopane, Poland
detailedDescription:
Attended the prestigious Math Kangaroo International Camp in Zakopane, Poland from Jul 29 to Aug 7, representing the USA in a team of the top 10 students nationally. The camp included advanced problem-solving sessions, workshops, and competitions with students from around the world.

This experience enhanced my mathematical skills and provided a unique opportunity to collaborate with international peers.

name: Street Smarts Video Contest
description: Won 2nd place in high school division
detailedDescription:
Got 2nd place in a local video contest organized by the City of San Ramon and Danville, focused on promoting traffic safety and awareness. The contest encouraged students to create engaging videos that highlight the importance of road safety, pedestrian awareness, and responsible driving.

My video, titled 'Stay Safe and Bike with Care', creatively addressed these issues and was recognized for its impact and creativity.

name: Street Smarts Video Contest
description: Won 2nd place in middle school division
detailedDescription:
Got 2nd place in a local video contest organized by the City of San Ramon and Danville, focused on promoting traffic safety and awareness. The contest encouraged students to create engaging videos that highlight the importance of road safety, pedestrian awareness, and responsible driving.

My video, titled 'Better be Safe than Sorry', creatively addressed these issues and was recognized for its impact and creativity.

name: Street Smarts Video Contest
description: Won 2nd place in middle school division
detailedDescription:
Got 2nd place in a local video contest organized by the City of San Ramon and Danville, focused on promoting traffic safety and awareness. The contest encouraged students to create engaging videos that highlight the importance of road safety, pedestrian awareness, and responsible driving.

My video, titled 'Be Aware and Walk with Care', creatively addressed these issues and was recognized for its impact and creativity.

name: Noetic Math Contest
detailedDescription:
Earned National Honorable Mention in the Noetic Math Contest, a mathematics competition for elementary and middle school students that emphasizes problem-solving skills and mathematical reasoning.

The contest includes a variety of challenging problems that test students' understanding of mathematical concepts and their ability to apply them in creative ways.

name: PTSA Reflections Contest
description: Won Award of Excellence in Music Composition, Literature and Award of Merit in Photography at school level
detailedDescription:
Won Award of Excellence in Music Composition, Literature and Award of Merit in Photography at middle school level in the PTSA Reflections Contest, a national arts recognition program that encourages students to explore their artistic talents.

My entries included an original music composition, a short story, and a photograph, all of which were recognized for their creativity and quality.

name: AoPS Short Story Contest
description: Won 1st place in the AoPS Short Story Contest for Pleasanton Branch
detailedDescription:
Won 1st place in the AoPS Short Story Contest for the Pleasanton Branch, a competition organized by Art of Problem Solving that encourages students to write creative and engaging short stories.

My winning entry, titled 'The Battle of Kyorokana', was praised for its imaginative plot and well-developed characters, showcasing my ability to blend creativity with technical themes.
